column2: Oregon offers the perfect conditions for growing the delicate Pinot Noir grape. And no one knew this better than Dick Erath, who was the first person to plant vines in the now famous Dundee Hills. Today, the same volcanic soils produce some of the state's best Pinot. And Erath consider this one of their best. Expect cherry, berry jam, raspberry and a hint of warm spice. Try this with your Sunday roast chicken.
column9: Vanilla, Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Spice

column1: Chateau Ste. Michelle Cabernet Sauvignon 2018/19, Columbia Valley
column2: Chateau Ste. Michelle is Washington's oldest and most respected winery. It's been named Winery of the Year no less than 22 times by Wine and Spirits magazine. This is a great alternative to Napa Cabernet at a lower price. Cabernet thrives in Washington State, and you'll taste the benefits in these complex notes of blackcurrant and plum. Try it with steak.
column9: Vanilla, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Cedar

column2: From Champagne house Louis Roederer's excellent Californian operation in the Anderson Valley. Reserve vintage wines are added to the Quartet, making it a multi-vintage cuvée in the traditional Roederer style. Crisp and elegant with complex pear, spice and hazelnut flavours. Fresh and lightly fruity with great finesse and depth of flavour. A brilliant apéritif, or try alongside lobster.
column9: Spice, Hazelnut, Pear

column1: Managers’ Choice: Zocker Grüner Veltliner 2019/20, Edna Valley
column2: Every year, we ask our store managers to choose their favourite bottle of wine from a delicious pool of contenders. This was their winner for 2022, and once you’ve tried it you’ll certainly see why. Grüner Veltliner isn’t a grape that’s often seen in California, so growing it there was something of a risk for the Zocker winery. But they stayed true to their name – which means ‘gambler’ in German – and the result is this innovative, aromatic white. It’s made with grapes from a single vineyard in Edna Valley, where cool ocean breezes give the fruit plenty of time to ripen and develop complex flavours. It’s full of lively lemon, lime and ripe melon notes, with hints of candied ginger and a characteristic kick of white pepper. Its refreshing, steely minerality makes it a great choice for rich and creamy goat’s cheese dishes.
column9: Lemon, Lime, Melon, Pear, White Pepper

column2: This really does what it says on the tin. It’s a lush Chardonnay which tastes of – you guessed it – bread and butter. The winemaking team combine grapes from two very different regions to create something full but fresh. Monterey is known for its big Chardonnays, but Carneros is far cooler, so flavours are more understated. And you'll taste the benefits in this bold and buttery wine. It’s silky smooth with fresh notes of citrus and vanilla. It’s incredibly versatile, but we like it best with creamy tarragon chicken or soft, creamy cheese.
column9: Vanilla, Almond, Coconut, Green Apple, Peach, Pineapple, Stone Fruit

column1: Bread & Butter 'Winemaker's Selection' Pinot Noir 2021, California
column2: Bread & Butter is that thing that you can count on. It’s dependable, comforting – you know what to expect. That’s exactly what you’ll get with this wine, a textbook Californian Pinot Noir from the same winery which brought you the sell-out Bread & Butter Chardonnay. Their vineyards are ideally located for classic varieties like Pinot. It’s sun-drenched, but cooled by the daily morning mists which roll in off the Pacific. It’s exactly the sort of position that pernickety Pinot thrives in. This deliciously silky wine proves our point. It’s all about red fruit. Cherries. Raspberries. Cranberries. It’s seriously juicy and seriously delicious, with a nice fullness which is classic California. Oak ageing gives it a touch of cedary spice, and woody herb notes. Perfect with roast mushrooms.
column9: Smoke, Black Cherry, Cedar, Raspberry, Red Fruit

column1: Bread & Butter 'Winemaker's Selection' Cabernet Sauvignon 2021, California
column2: California is where you’ll find some of the world’s most coveted Cabernet Sauvignon. This is made in the image of the very best of the Golden State – and it’s exclusive to us. Bread & Butter’s philosophy is all about simple pleasures, and their wines are crafted to reflect that. This classically-styled Cabernet is aged in both French and American oak to deepen complexity and soften the texture, making for a silky-smooth sip. Expect lavish flavours of ripe berries, mocha, black pepper and toasty vanilla. Soft tannins and plush fruit make it a fantastic partner for steak with tangy blue-cheese sauce.
column9: Vanilla, Black Pepper, Blackcurrant, Coffee

column2: Rocklin Ranch sits in the volcanic foothills of Monterey and is powered by a single wind turbine. They're just as dedicated to fantastic wine as they are the environment. And it really shows in this bold, structured Cabernet Sauvignon. It has notes of ripe plum, blackberry, blueberry, baking spices and toasty vanilla. Try it with a beef burger.
column9: Vanilla, Black Fruit, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blueberry

column2: Rocklin Ranch has sustainability at its heart. Situated in the volcanic foothills of Monterey, their winery is powered by a single wind turbine. They take their name from the ancient river rocks deposited around their vineyards. Monterey’s reputation for distinctive white wines is certainly reflected in this first-class bottle. Classic Chardonnay lovers, this one’s for you. Bright and elegant, this has notes of red apple, pear and lemon. Pair with a grilled chicken Caesar salad.
column9: Vanilla, Butter, Green Apple, Lemon, Peach, Tropical Fruit

column2: This Pinot Noir was crafted at the foot of Monterey’s volcanic mountain range. Here, the Scheid family’s winery is powered with a single wind turbine. They pay strict attention to detail, as only 2% of grapes picked are judged as good enough to make this Pinot Noir. So you're in for something great. This bright wine has notes of raspberry, strawberry and cherry tart with a hint of toasted oak and silky tannins. Serve with roasted pork loin.
column9: Vanilla, Cloves, Raspberry, Red Cherry, Red Fruit, Spice

column2: this wine won an IWC award for the 2019 vintage.\",£10.99 per bottle,75CL,Zinfandel,,Screwcap,10.9,Spice
column9: California

column2: If you love floral, fragrant, full-bodied whites then this delicious Viognier is an absolute must-try. California’s Viogniers fly a bit under-the-radar, so it’s a real bargain. It’s named ‘Nettie’ after Miss Nettie Valear who planted an acorn on the site of the now-vineyard in memory of Abraham Lincoln. Now a majestic oak, it’s a reminder that while California feels relatively ‘New World’, wine has been made there for more than two centuries. Classic varieties like Viognier flourish there. This wine is a case in point – it’s full of character. It’s big. It’s lush. It’s fruity. Full of peach and apricot flavours, with a really rich, round texture. Excellent with Thai spiced chicken or shellfish.
column9: Pear, Apricot, Floral, Honey, Peach

column2: Toast & Honey Chardonnay embodies everything there is to love about ripe and full-bodied New World whites. Produced by fourth-generation winemakers with links to some of the best grapes in Lodi, it’s an exclusive celebration of the bold character that has been leading the recent trends. And the care and attention goes beyond the bottle. Sustainable viticulture is key – efforts are focused on reducing water use and building healthy soil systems are all part of a movement towards maintaining a healthy wildlife habitat. Discover delicious toasted vanilla notes and honeyed flavours of stone fruits, baked apple and crème brûlée. Its rich texture makes it an ideal pairing for buttery roast chicken.
column9: Almond, Coconut, Green Apple, Honey, Peach, Pineapple, Stone Fruit, Vanilla, Toast

column2: This exclusive Pinot Noir is produced by fourth-generation winemakers with links to some of the best grapes in Lodi, California. Although it’s best known for its Zinfandel, Lodi’s Mediterranean climate produces Pinot Noir with the perfect balance of freshness and ripe, expressive flavours. And none showcase this better than Toast & Honey wines. In their vineyards, care for the vines carries over to the surrounding environment. With sustainability at the heart of everything they do, they promote cover crops and biodiversity – all helping to reduce evaporation, improve soil quality and create a healthy habitat for insects, bugs and, of course, bees. It’s classically silky Californian Pinot with juicy flavours of raspberry, cherry and berry compote, plus complex notes of baking spice from careful use of oak. Its balance of ripe-fruit flavour and oaky hints make it a perfect pairing for sautéed mushrooms or chargrilled meats.
column9: Black Cherry, Cedar, Raspberry, Red Fruit, Smoke, Toast

column2: Toast & Honey Cabernet Sauvignon embodies everything there is to love about ripe and full-bodied New World wines. It’s produced by fourth-generation winemakers with links to some of the best grapes in Lodi, California. And although it’s best known for its Zinfandel, Lodi’s Mediterranean climate produces Cabernet Sauvignon with the perfect balance of freshness and juicy, expressive flavours. This wine is a case in point – and the care and attention goes beyond the bottle. Nature is at the heart of the Toast & Honey range, and employing sustainable practices and promoting biodiversity in their vineyards is at the core of the entire operation. The result? Wine that proves that you can deliver delicious flavour while being kind to the earth. Expect notes of blackberry, black cherry, vanilla spice and chocolate. Its smooth tannins make it a great pairing with rich red meats.

column1: Bread & Butter Reserve Pinot Noir 2020/21, Russian River Valley
column2: Bold, delicious and crowd pleasing, it’s no wonder Bread & Butter’s wines have such a loyal following here at Majestic. Their Reserve collection celebrates the best of their Californian vineyards – with classic styles from some of the state’s most premium regions. And Russian River Valley is certainly a top spot for exceptional Pinot Noir. Here, cool fogs help to keep temperatures down, giving the grapes time to ripen slowly and develop intense, complex flavours. Under the expertise of winemaker Linda Trotta, Bread & Butter bring out the best of this prized fruit, crafting a bright, silky wine that’s a real step up from the norm. Discover vibrant notes of cherry, strawberry and sweet rhubarb, with touches of baking spice and earthy forest floor. The wine is aged for up to 12 months in oak, giving it soft tannins and a smooth texture – perfect with a rich steak or mushroom casserole.
column9: Black Cherry, Raspberry, Red Cherry, Strawberry, Sweet Spice

column2: Jake and Josh Beckett grew up in Paso Robles wine country. So it was no coincidence that the pair would found Chronic Cellars together back in 2004. ‘Chronic’ is the brothers’ shorthand for ‘awesome’, as, with thanks to their close contacts with the best grape growers, these wines are made from the finest grapes. It certainly shows in this Zinfandel-based blend which really does taste ‘purple’. Rich. Ripe. Bold. It’s full of plum, black fruit, lush vanilla and chocolate spice. Soft and approachable – it's the perfect wine to share with friends over barbecue pulled pork.
column9: Spice, Black Cherry, Blueberry, Chocolate

column1: Stag's Leap 'Hands of Time' Chardonnay 2019/20, Napa Valley
column2: Stag’s Leap shocked the world and beat the finest Bordeaux in the legendary Judgment of Paris in 1976. Ever since, theirs have become some of the most collected wines in the world. The Hands of Time is your chance to taste what all the fuss is about at a smaller sum. This is a medium-bodied, soft Chardonnay with hints of pear, pineapple, orange blossom, and a touch of oak on the finish. It’s exceptional with buttery pasta.
column9: Vanilla, Butter, Citrus Fruit, Grapefruit, Green Apple, Lemon, Peach, Stone Fruit

column2: Bread & Butter first soared to popularity with their lush Californian Chardonnay. So we’re thrilled to invite this vibrant rosé onto our shelves. It's a remarkably fresh blend of Grenache and Barbera, with bright notes of red fruits, melon and rooibos balanced by a zippy acidity. Try it with fresh seafood.
column9: Watermelon, Red Cherry, Rose, Strawberry

column1: Chronic Cellars 'Sir Real' Cabernet Sauvignon 2020/21, Paso Robles
column2: The Beckett brothers grew up in Paso Robles, washing oak barrels and working bottling lines. It was here that they formed life-long connections with local farmers. These ties mean they now have access to the region’s finest (or ‘Chronic’ as the duo call them) grapes. Their 'Sir Real' showcases the very best of Paso Robles Cabernet. Try its notes of black fruit and toasted spice with beef ribs.
column9: Savoury, Black Cherry, Black Fruit, Blackcurrant, Chocolate

column2: Edna Valley's vineyards are just a stone’s throw from the Californian coast, an area that's famous for its top-quality Chardonnay. You'll find big names like Napa and Sonoma nearby, but Edna Valley Vineyard choose to work within lesser-known wine regions instead – meaning they're where to go for quality and value. White peach. Apricot. Melon. The flavours are seriously ripe, but it’s still deliciously crisp and refreshing. A touch of oak adds a rich roundness and subtle spice, making it a perfect match for buttery pumpkin ravioli.
column9: Vanilla, Cream, Green Apple, Peach

column1: Edna Valley Pinot Noir 2020/21, Central Coast
column2: This is made from a number of lesser-known spots in California's Central Coast. The nearby Pacific ocean provides an almost constant breeze through the vineyards. This keeps fussy Pinot Noir grapes happy through a long growing season. And slow ripening grapes make complex and elegant wines. Central Coast may not grab the headlines like other nearby regions, but this means you get both great value and exceptional flavour. It's light and silky, with flavours of blackberry compote, black cherry, cranberry and a long, smooth finish. Try it with roast lamb, or roast mushroom dish.
column9: Vanilla, Black Cherry, Forest Floor, Red Fruit

column1: Bread & Butter Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon 2019/20, Napa Valley
column2: Bread & Butter are a firm Majestic favourite. Their wines are big, bold, and never hold back on flavour. Their fruit-forward philosophy has earned them a loyal following –  in the past we’ve even had to implement waiting lists to meet the growing demand. This reserve is a step up from their admired Cabernet Sauvignon. It’s made in Napa Valley, home to some of America’s finest reds, and has richness, complexity and delicious oaky spice in abundance. If you’re a fan of wines with character, this promises decadent flavour at great value. Expect intense notes of mocha, black fruits, vanilla and baking spices. Its rich texture and intense flavours will pair beautifully with flavoursome red meats.
column9: Black Cherry, Black Plum, Blackberry, Coffee, Spice

column2: Duckhorn is a Napa Valley icon. Its winemaking team are taking on a new terrain in Sonoma. The best part? The delicious wine made there is a fraction of the usual asking price. This is a lush, inviting Merlot, with notes of black cherry, blueberry, plum and dark chocolate. Pair with tomato-based pasta.
column6: Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon
column9: Spice, Black Cherry, Black Fruit, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blueberry, Raspberry

column2: Duckhorn is a Napa Valley icon. Its winemaking team are taking on a new terrain in Sonoma. The best part? The delicious wine made there is a fraction of the usual asking price. It's a rich, ripe Cabernet Sauvignon, with flavours of black fruits, plum, cedar and spice. Decant for an hour and serve at room temperature with a rack of ribs.
column9: Tobacco, Black Cherry, Black Fruit, Black Plum, Blackcurrant, Cedar, Chocolate

column1: Louis M. Martini 'Monte Rosso Vineyard Gnarly Vine' Zinfandel 2016/18, Sonoma
column2: Of all the Sonoma Valley’s many prized grape-growing locations, Monte Rosso Vineyard is arguably among the finest. Its steep rugged slopes stretch along the Mayacamas Mountains, where higher altitudes moderate the California sunshine. Louis Martini Winery has been farming the rich red volcanic soils here since 1938, producing terroir-driven wines from low-yielding vines. Grapes for the Gnarly Vine Zinfandel were handpicked, then after vinification aged in a blend of French and American oak barrels. Expect aromas of baked raspberry, cherries and mulberries rippled with cracked peppercorn, vanilla bean and the label’s characteristic spice. Rich and concentrated, this is a wine to crack open with chilli con carne, pulled pork or barbecued meats.
column9: Black Pepper, Black Plum, Cinnamon, Dried Herbs, Raspberry

column2: Dave Phinney went to Florence, Italy, for a semester abroad and fell in love with wine. After he graduated, he moved to Napa Valley, sent his CV to 50 wineries, and just one replied - Robert Mondavi. After a year there, he went it alone at with Orin Swift. Today begins with 100 different wines before selecting the perfect blend for the Abstract. This is a ripe and intense, with notes of black fruit, raspberry and liquorice. Decant for an hour before serving at 16-18 degrees.
column9: Spice, Black Pepper, Cranberry, Raspberry, Red Fruit, Red Plum

column2: In the mid 1800s, thousands flocked to California to chase the gold rush. One treasure-seeker in particular has been elevated to legend status – a bold gunslinger known throughout the region as 3 Finger Jack. The Delicato family, who have crafted wine in California for three generations, created this lively Zinfandel as a homage to him. Lodi is widely hailed as the Zinfandel capital of the world. Perched between San Francisco Bay and the Sierra Nevada Mountains, Lodi’s long, sunny days encourage grapes to reach their peak ripeness. The cool nights that follow lock in the rich flavour and help retain a refreshing acidity – producing world-class Zinfandel. Expect complex notes of ripe blackberry, dark cherry, plum, roasted coffee and toasty oak. The smooth tannins and bold, jammy flavours make it a great partner for pulled pork.
column9: Black Cherry, Black Plum, Blackberry, Coffee, Raspberry, Spice

column2: Fred Cline is a Californian great. He's one of the celebrated 'Rhône Rangers', who broke tradition by working with traditionally French grape varieties on the West Coast of America. Along with wife Nancy, he creates this silky, rich wine from the tricky Viognier grape. It's full bodied and powerful, with notes of tropical fruit, apricot and orange. An excellent match for Thai food.
column9: Vanilla, Peach, Pear, Pineapple, Stone Fruit

column1: Louis M. Martini Cabernet Sauvignon 2017/18, Sonoma County
column2: Louis Martini first voyaged to America from Italy with the goal to make the very best wines in the world. Unsurprisingly, his quest led him to California. We're glad it did. The Louis Martini winery was one of the first five to be built in Napa after prohibition. Several generations later, they're a part of the renowned region's winemaking history. Their Sonoma County Cabernet Sauvignon is fresh and full of blackberry, blueberry and red plum. Try it with rich tomato pasta.
column9: Blackcurrant, Vanilla, Black Cherry

column2: Barefoot Rosé is a straightforward, fruity wine with punchy tropical and strawberry notes and a refreshing acidity. Pair it with chicken, sea food or cheeses.
column9: Watermelon, Red Cherry, Strawberry

column2: Surviving prohibition by a legal loophole, Lodi boasts some of America's most ancient Zinfandel vines. Old vines craft the juiciest grapes. So it's no surprise that this pumps with black-fruit flavour. If you like a full-bodied red with gallons of taste, you'll love this.
column9: Spice, Black Cherry, Blueberry, Cocoa

column2: A complex, balanced Burgundy-style Chardonnay from the winery that put Caneros on the wine world map. It's tropical, nutty and balanced, with notes of apple compote and pear. It's deliciously fresh when young but will age excellently for three years. Best served lightly chilled.
column9: Vanilla, Apricot, Green Apple, Hazelnut, Melon, Peach, Spice

column2: Duckhorn Vineyards was one of the first forty wineries established in Napa Valley. The area has a stellar reputation for a reason – its vineyards are the first place to look for grapes of outstanding quality. Napa is inland and has higher temperatures than neighbouring coastal regions. These conditions make Chardonnay particularly rich and fruity. Think white peaches, blossom and creamy lemon flavours. This is a complex, textured white with. the subtle sweetness of French oak. It’s a sumptuous wine that will elevate a simple roast chicken to something really special.
column9: Vanilla, Bread, Green Apple, Peach, Pineapple, Sweet Spice, Tropical Fruit

column2: this wine won an IWC award for the 2019 vintage.\",£14.99 per bottle,37.5CL,Muscat,,Natural Cork,5.6,Stone Fruit
column9: White

column1: Au Bon Climat Chardonnay 2021/22, Santa Barbara County
column2: Jim Clendenen was a true pioneer. He contradicted assumptions that all Californian wines are ripe and fruity since 1982, when his were some of the very few Santa Barbara vineyards. He specialised in creating highly-acclaimed Burgundy-style wines from traditionally Burgundian grape varieties. This Chardonnay is a real Majestic classic. It's made from grapes hand-picked from 25-year-old vines and aged in French oak. As a result, there's subtle notes of vanilla and sweet spice that join flavours of lemon and lime. Try it with mushroom pasta.
column9: Vanilla, Green Apple, Lemon, Lime, Peach

column2: Over the past 34 years, Duckhorn have become one of the greatest wineries in America. They made their name in Napa County and have ventured out to Sonoma. The best part? What they make there is still at a low price. Their expertise really shines in this Zinfandel. It has aromas of ripe blackberry, wild blueberry, plum and blackcurrant, along with hints of cedar and spice. Pair this with lamb stew.
column9: White Pepper, Black Cherry, Blueberry, Chocolate, Red Cherry, Spice

column2: this wine won an IWC award for the 2018 vintage.\",£14.99 per bottle,37.5CL,Black Muscat,,Natural Cork,5.6,Sweet Spice

In 1985 world-famous cardiac surgeon Dr. Elias Hanna founded the Hanna winery. He quickly became an iconic winemaker. And his daughter, Christine, today leads the way with this complex, elegant Chardonnay. Expect notes of tropical fruit, caramel and vanilla. Serve this at 10-13 degrees with roast chicken.
column9: Vanilla, Apricot, Green Apple, Green Fruit, Peach, Stone Fruit, Tropical Fruit

column1: J Vineyards 'J Cuvée 20 Brut', Russian River Valley
column2: J Vineyards was founded in Sonoma's cool climate Russian River by Judy Jordan in 1994. It is today headed by talented winemaker Nicole Hitchcock, who continues to roll out world-class wines. Expect a rich mousse and complex palate of lemon meringue, ripe apple and ginger.
column9: Red Apple, Almond, Cream, Ginger, Lemon

column2: Jamie Goode 94 Points 12.5% alcohol. Beautiful stuff, combining sweet ripe pear and apple fruit with some lively grapefruit freshness, and also a subtly smoky, mineral twist. There's good acidity here, and a slightly bitter twist that offsets the fruit nicely. Complex and beguiling with concentration, balance and finesse. The fruit profile hints at California, but the acid structure and poise is very European. I really like it, and it should age really well.Doesn't seem to be as overtly reductive as the two previous Kutch Chardonnays. 94/100
column9: Wet Stones, Citrus Fruit, Grapefruit, Green Apple, Peach, Vanilla

column1: Louis Martini Cabernet Sauvignon 2017/18, Napa Valley
column2: Louis Martini left Italy for America with one vision: to create the world's greatest wines. He had a key idea that the best grapes made the best wines. So, naturally, he ended up in Napa Valley. His was one of the first five wineries built in Napa after the repeal of Prohibition. And today, it's the go-to for lovers of 'Napa Cab' in the know. This is a savoury and full-bodied wine, with flavours of black plum, blackcurrant and vanilla that are great with red meat and rosemary potatoes. Leading US wine critic James Suckling gave it a 92-point score.
column9: Black Plum, Blackcurrant, Vanilla

column2: James Suckling called this 2015 vintage ''a wonderful, linear and bright white'' when he gave it 94 points. Decanter gave it the same score. Grown at lofty heights, the Mayacamas Chardonnay bursts with roasted cashews and hazelnuts, waxy lemon and lime zest. The finish is clean and long.
column9: Vanilla, Blossom, Green Apple, Hazelnut, Peach

column2: The Most Wanted Zinfandel is grown in Lodi, in California's Central Valley, which is renowned for Zinfandel wines. Uncork a heady marriage of ripe blackberry, dark cherry and plum powered by a coating mouthfeel and plush tannins.
column9: Vanilla, Black Cherry, Blueberry, Spice

column2: Unashamedly powerful and fruity this is resplendent with cherry and raspberry flavours followed buy notes of sweet spice and star anise.
column9: Sweet Spice, Blackcurrant, Liquorice, Raspberry, Red Cherry

column1: Parcel Series Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir 2020
column2: Our Parcel Series collection is for when top-class wineries need to make space in their cellars quickly and discreetly. So we pick up their wines at a fraction of the usual price and pass the savings onto you. The catch? We can't tell you who makes it. This is the very exciting 50th entry to the Parcel Series range. It's one of our best savings yet, as it usually sells for three times the price. It's a Sonoma Pinot that takes on the finest red Burgundy. It's even aged for 30 months in Burgundy barrels. This brings a delicious oak spice to its notes of wild strawberries. Try it with duck pancakes.
column9: Cream, Red Cherry, Red Fruit, Vanilla

column1: Ramey 'Rochioli Vineyard' Chardonnay 2015, Russian River Valley
column2: After working for two decades at world-famous wineries, such as Dominius, David Ramey went his own way with Ramey Wine Cellars. It's safe to say he's excelled with this single-vineyard Chardonnay. Aged for 20 months in vanilla-imparting oak, the alluring hints of sweet spice, creamy stone fruits grapefruit and citrus in this full-bodied white scored 94 Parker Points.
column9: Vanilla, Cream, Green Apple, Peach, Sweet Spice

column1: Ridge East Bench Zinfandel 2019/20, Sonoma County
column2: Ridge has made the East Bench as a single-site zinfandel since 2006. One of only two Ridge zinfandels that is entirely from the single varietal. The vineyard sits high atop the bench land that overlooks Dry Creek Valley from the east. A nose of rich raspberry and pepper accompanied by floral and mineral notes. The palate is layered with dark cherry and black currant fruit, mineral, and cocoa. Balanced acidity with fine tannins on the finish.
column9: Spice, Black Cherry, Black Fruit, Blackcurrant, Blueberry, Cocoa

column2: Ridge Vineyards have been the darlings of critical praise for decades. They were some of the first to champion old-vine Zinfandel, making it since 1964. And some of the vines behind this Zinfandel-dominated blend are over 130-years-old. Expect intense notes of black cherry, oak spice, cola, mint and blackcurrant. It's excellent with turkey and pulled pork.
column9: Red Fruit, Black Fruit, Blueberry, Raisin

column2: In Carneros, the cool-climate spot of California that pampers the fussy Pinot Noir grape, the Saintsbury winery picks grapes at night and squeezes them within an hour. This brings a delightful freshness to a perfumed bouquet of rose petal, dark cherry, rhubarb and white pepper.
column9: White Pepper, Black Cherry, Black Fruit, Red Fruit, Rose

column1: Stag's Leap 'Hands of Time' Red Blend 2018/19, Napa Valley
column2: Stag’s Leap shocked the world and beat the finest Bordeaux in the legendary Judgment of Paris in 1976. Ever since, theirs have become some of the most collected wines in the world. This Bordeaux blend really shows why they demanded the respect of those wine critics 34 years ago. Expect notes of dark fruit and chocolate truffle. Try this with pork tacos.
column6: Petite Sirah, Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Petit Verdot
column9: Vanilla, Black Fruit, Black Plum, Blackberry, Blackcurrant, Chocolate, Red Cherry, Red Fruit, Tobacco
